case_details.case_name: Family Properties v. JDK Management, et al

document.long_desc: COMPLAINT filed; FILING FEE $ 150.00 RECEIPT # B153429 (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
SUMMONS(ES)(20 days) issued for JDK Management, Daniel A. Klingerman (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
Local Rule 103.3 Certification by Family Properties and attachment. (c/s) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)

MOTION with memorandum in support by JDK Management, Daniel A. Klingerman to Dismiss , or to Stay action pending terminiation of state proceeding pursuant to FRCP 12 i, and exhibits A and B. (c/s) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
ORDER SETTING date for hearing. ( signed by Judge Andre M. Davis 3/17/99) (c/m 3/18/99) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)

RESPONSE by Family Properties in opposition to [4-1] motion of Defendants to Dismiss and to [4-2] motion of Defendants to Stay action pending terminiation of state proceeding pursuant to FRCP and exhibit A. (c/s) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
ORDER granting [7-1] motion of plaintiff for Jonathan Staebler to Appear Pro Hac Vice. ( signed by Judge Andre M. Davis 4/6/99) (c/m 4/7/99) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
SCHEDULING ORDER ( signed by Judge Andre M. Davis 4/12/99 ) (c/m 4/12/99) (jlb, Deputy Clerk)
NOTICE of attorney appearance by Jonathan Staebler and Wilkinson & Staebler, LLC for Family Properties. (jlb, Deputy Clerk)
ANSWER to Complaint and COUNTERCLAIM by Daniel A. Klingerman, JDK Management (Attorney ) against Family Properties, Family Enterprises, Inc., and Bruce Snyder. (c/s) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
SUMMONS(ES) (20 day) issued for Family Enterprises, Bruce L. Snyder. (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
RETURN OF SERVICE executed as to Family Properties, Family Enterprises, Bruce L. Snyder 4/29/99; Answer due on 10/3/97 to counterclaim. (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
ANSWER by Family Properties, Family Enterprises, Bruce L. Snyder to [10-2] counter claim of JDK Management, Daniel A. Klingerman. (c/s) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
NOTICE by Family Properties RE: Settlement Agreement (c/s) (jnl, Deputy Clerk)

ORDER DISMISSING civil action with each party to bear its own costs unless otherwise agreed, without prejudice to the right of a party to move for good cause within 30 days to reopen this action if settlement is not consummated. (signed by Judge Andre M. Davis 10/13/99) (c/m 10/14/99) (microfilmed 10/14/99) (mdd, Deputy Clerk)
